result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:36 PM Defendant Laron Chaz Thomas in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica Phelps in court for Laron Chaz Thomas. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Laron Chaz Thomas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Laron Chaz Thomas.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
